author: Tom Fairless
title: Latvia Detains Top ECB Official in Anticorruption Probe
text:
A top European Central Bank official was detained over the weekend by Latvia’s anticorruption agency as part of a criminal investigation, the country’s prime minister said on Sunday, in the latest blow to the small Baltic nation’s financial sector.

Prime Minister Maris Kucinskis said he would convene an extraordinary cabinet meeting on Monday to discuss the detention of Ilmars Rimšēvičs, who sits on the ECB’s rate-setting committee as governor of the Bank of Latvia, according to a statement published on the prime minister’s...
